name: Monitor SEO Keyword Rankings with SERP API & Send Drop Alerts via Slack

user.name: Oneclick AI Squad
user.bio: The AI Squad Initiative is a pioneering effort to build, automate and scale AI-powered workflows using n8n.io. Our mission is to help individuals and businesses integrate AI agents seamlessly into their daily operations  from automating tasks and enhancing productivity to creating innovative, intelligent solutions. We design modular, reusable AI workflow templates that empower creators, developers and teams to supercharge their automation with minimal effort and maximum impact.

description:
This automated workflow monitors your website's keyword rankings daily and sends instant alerts to your team when significant ranking drops occur. It fetches current ranking positions, compares them with historical data, and triggers notifications through Slack and email when keywords drop beyond your defined threshold.

## Good to know
* The workflow uses SERP API for accurate ranking data; API costs apply based on your usage volume
* Ranking checks are performed daily to avoid overwhelming search engines with requests
* The system tracks ranking changes over time and maintains historical data for trend analysis
* Slack integration requires workspace permissions and proper bot configuration
* False positives may occur due to personalized search results or data center variations

## How it works
* **Daily SEO Check Trigger** initiates the workflow on a scheduled basis
* **Get Keywords Database** retrieves your keyword list and current ranking data
* **Filter Active Keywords Only** processes only keywords marked as active for monitoring
* **Fetch Google Rankings via SERP API** gets current ranking positions for each keyword
* **Wait For Response** Wait for gets current ranking positions
* **Parse Rankings & Detect Changes** compares new rankings with historical data and identifies significant drops
* **Filter Significant Ranking Drops** isolates keywords that dropped beyond your threshold (e.g., 5+ positions)
* **Send Slack Ranking Alert** notifies your team channel about ranking drops
* **Send Email Ranking Alert** sends detailed email reports to stakeholders
* **Update Rankings in Google Sheet** saves new ranking data for historical tracking
* **Generate SEO Monitoring Summary** creates a comprehensive report of all ranking changes

## How to use
* Import the workflow into n8n and configure your SERP API credentials
* Set up your Google Sheet with the required keyword database structure
* Configure Slack webhook URL and email SMTP settings
* Define your ranking drop threshold (recommended: 5+ position drops)
* Test the workflow with a small keyword set before full deployment
* Schedule the workflow to run daily during off-peak hours

## Requirements
* **SERP API account** with sufficient credits for daily keyword checks
* **Google Sheets access** for keyword database and ranking storage
* **Slack workspace** with webhook permissions for team notifications
* **Email service** (SMTP or API) for stakeholder alerts
* **Keywords database** properly formatted in Google Sheets

## Database/Sheet Columns Required

### Google Sheet: "Keywords Database"
Create a Google Sheet with the following columns:

| Column Name | Description | Example |
|-------------|-------------|---------|
| `keyword` | Target keyword to monitor | "best seo tools" |
| `domain` | Your website domain | "yourwebsite.com" |
| `current_rank` | Latest ranking position | 5 |
| `previous_rank` | Previous day's ranking | 3 |
| `status` | Monitoring status | "active" |
| `target_url` | Expected ranking URL | "/best-seo-tools-guide" |
| `search_volume` | Monthly search volume | 1200 |
| `difficulty` | Keyword difficulty score | 65 |
| `date_added` | When keyword was added | "2025-01-15" |
| `last_checked` | Last monitoring date | "2025-07-30" |
| `drop_threshold` | Custom drop alert threshold | 5 |
| `category` | Keyword grouping | "Product Pages" |

## Customising this workflow
* **Modify ranking thresholds** in the "Filter Significant Ranking Drops" node to adjust sensitivity (e.g., 3+ positions vs 10+ positions)
* **Add competitor monitoring** by duplicating the SERP API node and tracking competitor rankings for the same keywords
* **Customize alert messages** in Slack and email nodes to include your brand voice and specific stakeholder information
* **Extend to multiple search engines** by adding Bing or Yahoo ranking checks alongside Google
* **Implement ranking improvement alerts** to celebrate when keywords move up significantly
* **Add mobile vs desktop tracking** by configuring separate SERP API calls for different device types

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

workflow.name: SEO Keyword Rank Monitor with Drop Alerts for Your Team

nodes.name: Daily SEO Check Trigger
nodes.notes:
üïê DAILY SCHEDULER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Automatically runs SEO checks every day at 8 AM
‚Ä¢ Ensures consistent daily monitoring without manual intervention
‚Ä¢ Uses cron expression '0 8 * * *' for daily 8 AM execution
‚Ä¢ Essential for tracking keyword ranking changes over time

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Triggers the entire SEO monitoring workflow
‚Ä¢ Runs Monday through Sunday automatically
‚Ä¢ Can be modified to run multiple times per day if needed

nodes.name: Get Keywords Database
nodes.notes:
üìä KEYWORD DATABASE

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Stores all keywords to monitor in one central location
‚Ä¢ Easy to add/remove keywords without changing workflow
‚Ä¢ Maintains historical ranking data for comparison
‚Ä¢ Allows team collaboration on keyword list management

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Reads keywords, target URLs, and previous rankings
‚Ä¢ Provides data structure: keyword, url, previous_rank, current_rank
‚Ä¢ Acts as the source of truth for all SEO monitoring
‚Ä¢ Enables bulk processing of multiple keywords

nodes.name: Filter Active Keywords Only
nodes.notes:
üîç KEYWORD FILTER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Saves API costs by only checking active keywords
‚Ä¢ Prevents processing empty or disabled keyword entries
‚Ä¢ Allows temporary disabling of specific keyword monitoring
‚Ä¢ Improves workflow efficiency and performance

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Filters out empty keyword fields
‚Ä¢ Only processes keywords marked as 'monitor_active = true'
‚Ä¢ Reduces unnecessary API calls to SERP services
‚Ä¢ Ensures clean data flow to ranking APIs

nodes.name: Fetch Google Rankings via SERP API
nodes.notes:
üåê GOOGLE RANKING FETCHER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Gets real-time Google search rankings for keywords
‚Ä¢ Uses SERP API to avoid Google blocking/rate limiting
‚Ä¢ Fetches top 100 results to catch ranking changes
‚Ä¢ Provides accurate, location-specific ranking data

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Searches Google for each keyword
‚Ä¢ Returns organic search results with positions
‚Ä¢ Captures ranking data for specified location (US)
‚Ä¢ Handles Google's anti-bot measures automatically
‚Ä¢ Costs ~$0.001 per search (check SERP API pricing)

nodes.name: Parse Rankings & Detect Changes
nodes.notes:
‚öôÔ∏è RANKING ANALYZER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Processes complex SERP API responses into usable data
‚Ä¢ Finds your website's position in search results
‚Ä¢ Calculates ranking changes compared to previous data
‚Ä¢ Determines which keywords need attention/alerts

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Searches through 100 organic results for your URL
‚Ä¢ Matches domain/subdomain to find exact ranking
‚Ä¢ Calculates ranking improvement/drop numbers
‚Ä¢ Sets alert flags for drops > 2 positions
‚Ä¢ Handles cases where website is not found in top 100

nodes.name: Filter Significant Ranking Drops
nodes.notes:
üö® ALERT FILTER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Only sends alerts for significant ranking changes
‚Ä¢ Prevents spam from minor 1-2 position fluctuations
‚Ä¢ Focuses attention on keywords that truly need action
‚Ä¢ Saves notification costs and reduces alert fatigue

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Filters keywords with drops > 2 positions
‚Ä¢ Includes keywords that disappeared from top 100
‚Ä¢ Passes only actionable ranking issues
‚Ä¢ Reduces noise in alerting system

nodes.name: Update Rankings in Google Sheet
nodes.notes:
üìà RANKING HISTORY TRACKER

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Maintains historical ranking data for trend analysis
‚Ä¢ Updates previous_rank for next day's comparison
‚Ä¢ Creates audit trail of all ranking changes
‚Ä¢ Enables manual review and reporting

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Updates current rankings in Google Sheet
‚Ä¢ Records ranking changes and status
‚Ä¢ Timestamps each check for historical tracking
‚Ä¢ Stores found URLs for verification
‚Ä¢ Prepares data for next day's comparison

nodes.name: Send Slack Ranking Alert
nodes.notes:
üí¨ SLACK NOTIFICATION

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Provides instant alerts to SEO team
‚Ä¢ Rich formatting shows ranking details clearly
‚Ä¢ Integrates with existing team communication
‚Ä¢ Allows immediate team discussion and action

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Sends formatted alert to designated Slack channel
‚Ä¢ Includes keyword, ranking change, and URLs
‚Ä¢ Shows current vs previous ranking comparison
‚Ä¢ Provides actionable information for quick response
‚Ä¢ Can mention specific team members if needed

nodes.name: Send Email Ranking Alert
nodes.notes:
üìß EMAIL NOTIFICATION

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Provides detailed alert for serious ranking drops
‚Ä¢ Creates email trail for management reporting
‚Ä¢ Reaches team members who may not use Slack
‚Ä¢ Professional format suitable for stakeholder updates

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Sends HTML-formatted email with ranking details
‚Ä¢ Includes actionable recommendations
‚Ä¢ Shows before/after ranking comparison
‚Ä¢ Provides links for immediate investigation
‚Ä¢ Can be forwarded to management or clients

nodes.name: Generate SEO Monitoring Summary
nodes.notes:
üìä EXECUTION SUMMARY

Why this node?
‚Ä¢ Provides overview of daily SEO monitoring results
‚Ä¢ Tracks workflow performance and success metrics
‚Ä¢ Helps identify trends in keyword performance
‚Ä¢ Useful for reporting and debugging

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Counts total keywords processed
‚Ä¢ Summarizes alerts sent and ranking changes
‚Ä¢ Calculates average ranking across all keywords
‚Ä¢ Logs detailed execution summary to console
‚Ä¢ Creates data for dashboard reporting
‚Ä¢ Confirms workflow completed successfully

parameters.content:
## How it works
* **Daily SEO Check Trigger** initiates the workflow on a scheduled basis
* **Get Keywords Database** retrieves your keyword list and current ranking data
* **Filter Active Keywords Only** processes only keywords marked as active for monitoring
* **Fetch Google Rankings via SERP API** gets current ranking positions for each keyword
* **Wait For Response** Wait for gets current ranking positions
* **Parse Rankings & Detect Changes** compares new rankings with historical data and identifies significant drops
* **Filter Significant Ranking Drops** isolates keywords that dropped beyond your threshold (e.g., 5+ positions)
* **Send Slack Ranking Alert** notifies your team channel about ranking drops
* **Send Email Ranking Alert** sends detailed email reports to stakeholders
* **Update Rankings in Google Sheet** saves new ranking data for historical tracking
* **Generate SEO Monitoring Summary** creates a comprehensive report of all ranking changes

main.node: Fetch Google Rankings via SERP API
